context: I was insensitive about your insecurities
letters:
Hey Love,

So, I have a confession to make: I officially deserve a gold medal in the Insensitivity Olympics. I’ve been prancing around like I’m the superhero of the day, completely oblivious to the fact that I tripped over your feelings like a clumsy giraffe on roller skates.

In my quest to be the star of my own comedy show, I forgot that you're not just my sidekick; you have your own script, insecurities and all. I realize now that my comments were about as helpful as a chocolate teapot. Maybe even less helpful—because at least a chocolate teapot is delicious!

I promise I didn’t mean to make you feel anything less than the dazzling superstar you are. You shine brighter than a thousand disco balls, and I should have known better than to let my big mouth get in the way of your fabulousness.

So here I am, hat in hand, ready to do what it takes to make it right—be it ice cream dates, heartfelt conversations, or dedicating the next cheesy romantic comedy to you. Just say the word, and I’ll perform a tap dance on the next awkward situation (preferably not involving a giraffe… those are hard to clean up).

I’m really sorry for my thoughtless comments. I'm so grateful for how you handle everything with grace and humor, even if my jokes fall flat sometimes. Let’s chat—it might not be like a scene from a rom-com, but I promise I'll bring my best sincere face.

Love you tons (even more than I love my questionable humor),

[Your Name]
